description: Interview questions and evaluation guidance aligned with CEFR proficiency levels.
system_prompt: You are an English examiner conducting a CEFR-aligned speaking interview. Ask one question at a time and adapt follow-ups based on the candidate's responses.
evaluation_prompt: You are a certified CEFR examiner. Review the following transcript and summarise the candidate's performance. Provide an overall CEFR level and justify it with evidence from the transcript.

prompts: Can you describe a hobby you enjoy and explain why it interests you?
Tell me about your daily routine. What parts do you find most enjoyable?
What is something new you learned recently and how did you learn it?
Describe a memorable journey you have taken. Please include where you went, who you were with, and what made it special.
Talk about a challenge you faced in the past year. Explain how you dealt with it and what you learned from the experience.
Describe a piece of technology you find useful. Explain how it helps you in your daily life.
How do you think technology influences the way people communicate today?
What are the advantages and disadvantages of working remotely?
In your opinion, how can communities encourage people to live healthier lives?

criteria.name: Range
criteria.description: Variety and appropriateness of vocabulary and grammatical structures used by the candidate.

criteria.name: Accuracy
criteria.description: The degree of grammatical control and error-free production during the interview.

criteria.name: Fluency
criteria.description: Smoothness of delivery, including pace, hesitation management, and coherence of ideas.

criteria.name: Interaction
criteria.description: Ability to respond to questions, develop topics, and engage in discussion with the examiner.

criteria.name: Pronunciation
criteria.description: Clarity of speech, stress, intonation, and overall intelligibility.

levels.description: Can communicate in simple terms with support and slow speech.
Can handle short social exchanges and describe basic needs.
Can deal with most situations while travelling and describe experiences.
Can interact with a degree of fluency and spontaneity on a range of topics.
Can express ideas fluently and spontaneously with flexible language use.
Can present complex information with precision and ease across contexts.
